intro: Ageratum alternifolium, commonly known as the alternate-leaf ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant has alternate leaves that are typically ovate or lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Ageratum alternifolium prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
